subject: [Ip-health] New CIEL IP and EPAs Publication
body:
This is a multi-part message in MIME format.
--
[ Picked text/plain from multipart/alternative ]
Dear Friends,



As part of its ongoing work on IP and European partnership agreements, CIEL
has published a discussion paper (drawn from the IP Quarterly Fourth Quarter
  2006) on the European
Union's attempts to impose TRIPS-plus standards on 76 African, Caribbean and
Pacific (ACP) countries.  The paper outlines the statements and the
positions that the EU has taken in its negotiations with the ACP and
describes the approach of the EU to IP in the proposed EPAs. It concludes
that the EU attaches central importance to IP in the EPA negotiations and
suggests some reasons why.



The paper is available at
http://www.ciel.org/Publications/EU_EPAs_Draft_18Apr07.pdf. Please feel free
to distribute further on email and other lists.



Best

Dalindyebo Shabalala

Director, Intellectual Property and Sustainable Development Project

Center for International Environmental Law

15 Rue des Savoises

1205 Geneva

Switzerland

Phone: +41 22 321 4774

Fax: +41 22 789 0739
